0: National Archives NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Yes, it’s that time again, folks. It’s the first Friday of the month, when for one ever-so-brief moment the interests of Wall Street, Washington and Main Street are all aligned on one thing: Jobs. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR After last month, when the hype concluded the June report would be the most important one, like, ever, this month’s affair is demure. It delivered a bit more than expected, however. The economy added 195,000 jobs in June, albeit the unemployment rate was flat at 7.6%.
